ext_description.p: A Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation is the association between the connectivity requirements and the component and joints that provide that connectivity. The component specified by implementation_component participate in an assembly relationship with the components whose terminals are specified by the physical_node_requirement in order for the total connectivity specified by physical_node_requirement to be achieved. There may be more than one member of physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component for a member of if the nodal implementation is split among more than one component.
ext_description.note: The Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation is a link in the traceability path between the functional definition and the geometric representation of the interconnect substrate conductive patterns.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the implementation_joint_set specifies the role of the for the Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation. The implementation_joint_set identifies the joints that attach the terminals specified by the connectivity requirement to the features of the component that is implementing that requirement. The implementation_joint_set identifies the joints that attach the terminals of interface components to the features of the component that is implementing that requirement.

the implementation_interface_joint_set specifies the role of the for the Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation. The implementation_interface_joint_set identifies the joints that attach the terminals specified by the connectivity requirement to the interface features of the component that is implementing that requirement.

the implementation_component specifies the role of the for the Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation. The implementation_component is the component physically providing the implementation of connectivity stated by the requirements.
the physical_node_requirement specifies the role of the for the Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation.
The implementation_component, implementation_interface_joint_set, implementation_joint_set, and physical_node_requirement shall be in the same design view.
Either implementation_interface_joint_set shall be provided or implementation_joint_set shall be provided, but both shall not be provided.

ext_description.p: Each member of implementation_joint_set shall reference a feature of implementation_component in its set of assembly_features. Each member of implementation_joint_set shall either reference a that is also referenced by the attribute associated_terminals of the physical_node_requirement, or shall reference a join terminal of the implementation_component referenced by another member of Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation where the interface terminal is referenced by implementation_interface_joint_set of that Physical_node_requirement_to_implementing_component_allocation.
ext_description.note: This rule reduces potential confusion caused by more than one implementation_component implementing a single binary connection between two terminals.
